name: Number of pairs (u,v) for which there is a set of n positive integers X = {x_1, ..., x_n} with u = |X+X| = #{x_i + x_j : 1 <= i,j <=n} and v = |X*X| = #{x_i * x_j : 1 <= i,j <=n}.
comment: As 2n-1 <= |X+X|,|X*X| <= n(n+1)/2 by combinatorics, we know that a(n) <= 1/4 (n^2-3n+4)^2 <= 0.25 n^4 - 1.5 n^3 + O(n^2).
In "Visualizing the Sum-Product Conjecture", the bound a(n) <= (1/4)*(24 - 40*n + 27*n^2 - 8*n^3 + n^4) = 0.25 n^4 -2 n^3 +O(n^2) is proved.
link: Kevin O'Bryant, Visualizing the sum-product conjecture, arXiv:2411.08139 [math.NT], 2024.
author: _Kevin O'Bryant_, Dec 02 2024
